rev.comment: /* Controversies and allegations of bias */ (More matching to the CNN article.)
/* Allegations of bias */ (Made to match format at CNN)
Order of sections arranged to match the order at [[CNN]].

just notice the infobox that i'm implementing is not an official wikipedia one so no infobox for now
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Warzybok|Warzybok]] to last version by Kevin baas

re-reversion. This point is very relivant. if the group is listed by wikipedia as "liberal", then it is disengenuous to present them as neutral. take a look at their site before denying they are bised
rv. - characterization irrelevant and inappropriate - the statistics are not biased, and the characterization of them as biased is misleading.
pointed out the possible bias in the Fairness and accuracy in reporting group by identifying them as "liberal", a claim suported by their wikipedia article.
removal of FAIR section was ad hominem - just because org is "progressive", doesn't mean there're wrong
This section is obviously not applicable, as the said organisation is listed as "progressive" in the opening line of its description, making this section excessively misleading.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/66.234.216.211|66.234.216.211]] to last version by Crazyeddie
Bias is discussed in later section. Removing from intro.
/* Allegations of bias */ lets just state facts and let the reader draw conclusions
/* Ratings success */FOX News beat CNN, MSNBC during Democrat Conv., broadcast networks during Republican one

rv. i miswrote my cite of the section in the NPOV tutorial, there is no "space and content" section, i meant "space and balance", the intro of which links to "interesting" which redirs to "informative
rv, no your cite was to "space and content"
rv. my cite was, via [[Wikipedia:NPOV tutorial]], [[Wikipedia:Informative]], the bottom of the page regarding "obvious". correl. of attention to news is counter-intuitive and ergo non-obvious
rv, space should not be devoted to such a minor result, per Baas cite
rv. "behind several other" is insignificant (obvious) and therefore inappropriate (see [[Wikipedia:NPOV tutorial#Space and content]]. ), also which direction (co or antico) was lost.
/* Allegations of bias */ making added statement more accurate
/* Personalities */ the only place this is claimed is here in trying to summarize - if we include the quote it needs attribution
/* Personalities */ Further refined table column break placement.
/* Personalities */ detail about Comes belongs in his article.
/* Personalities */ added reference to the term "Fox News liberal" (a type of "DINO"), which was first used to describe Alan Colmes.
/* Allegations of bias */ update wikilink to skip disambiguation page
/* Allegations of bias */ Moved see also, in accordance with Manual of Style. Replaced HTML tags. Reinstated Faux News sentence, with link.
/* Allegations of bias */ NPOV, a phrase like "belie" should be in a quote if it is to be used, "Faux News" should be attributed
/* Programming */ Linked to Liberalism in the United States.
/* Personalities */ allegations of bias already has its own section
/* Other countries */ Trinidad -> Trinidad and Tobago
/* Allegations of bias */ tightened up wordy paragraph
/* Programming */ whoops, TZ was already in the section intro
We don't need to reiterate "alleged" when it's clearly a paraphrase of critics' charges; they don't claim Fox has an alleged bias, they claim it has a bias
/* Allegations of bias */ making new point a little more concise
/* Allegations of bias */ NPOVed language (same thing that was done at the CNN article)
/* Trademark disputes */ Al Franken --> Franken on second naming; rm "this writing"
/* Other countries */ Removed countries also listed above.
/* External links */ Removed non-notable link to parody Faux News website
"Faux News" name is as notable as CNN's alternate parody names (Clinton News Network), see talk page.
/* Allegations of bias */ (some of whom call it "Faux News") is not notable
/* Allegations of bias */ counterspin on Bush DUI
move allegations of bias section to end of article
Moved PIPA report back to Allegations, removed part which PIPA did not consider a demonstrable misperception, inserted percentages for all other networks.
/* Allegations of bias */ Removed liberal. Was true before. Does it mean Rawlsian or leftist?
"Fair and balanced" link content is not contained within article on FOX, not necessary for inclusion.
rv, countering liberal bias is implied by the "fair and balanced" slogan, follow the "fair and balanced" link and you will see this point made
/* Allegations of bias */ Removed [[Liberal bias]], not relevant since no one is accusing FOX of that
rv, there is already a wiki link to conservative bias above, but not one to liberal bias yet
/* Allegations of bias */ deleted the version that noone supports and added the version that at least I support, in a section which does not compromise my scientific integrity
/* Allegations of bias */ Fixed link directly to report
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/198.146.95.122|198.146.95.122]] to last version by 207.218.209.124
/* Allegations of bias */ remove editorializing about what facts mean
Please leave the PIPA report in there Silverback. No one but you is in favour of removing it.
/* Allegations of bias */ there is no need for something at best tangentially about bias, in the midst of all this other evidence, the other evidence is sufficient
/* Allegations of bias */ Cited article refers to all US media, not FNC.
/* Allegations of bias */ study by the [[Project for Excellence in Journalism]]
Some minority of viewers Silverback you are in the minority of those who want to see the PIPA report removed. PIPA did research and a study. It did not claim to refute anything.
/* Allegations of bias */ No original research, cite an expert that states that a "misperception" among a minority of viewers is evidence of biased coverage
/* Allegations of bias */ Give a good reason for changing it or leave it
Revert to chameleon's last edit, quoted directly from PIPA report, removed last edit
/* Allegations of bias */ new compromise language
/* Allegations of bias */ examples from Outfoxed
/* Allegations of bias */ restore original compromise
/* Allegations of bias */ Quoted directly from PIPA report.
/* Allegations of bias */ still think PIPA report is totally useless but here goes a propsed edit
The PIPA report is obviously crucial
/* Ratings success */ the claim re individuals isn't relevant and February 2005 results show 1.57 million viewers for FOX News during primetime vs 637k for cnn
rewording & not sure how including Turner comment in that spot isn't act of POV?
Polls in general are NOT acceptable. They show associations, not causation. See the Talk Page for my post Ethereal
Reverted, PIPA is no more invalid than other polls.
/* Allegations of bias */ PIPA study not relevant to allegations of bias
Reverted to add PIPA, see talk page
altering heading to include encouraging misperceptions
/* Allegations of bias */ the PIPA study was not about "allegations of bias"
Removed PIPA counterpoints, see talk page
/* Personalities */ move Colmes criticism to paragraph about liberal personalities, but mentioning it is an important part of the claim that Fox is biased, so it should remain
/* Personalities */ wikilink colmes - criticism of his style better placed in [[Alan Colmes]] article
/* Personalities */ update--Colmes criticized for being weak
/* Personalities */ Hannity is primetime (9-10pm) a conservative paired with a liberal as a co-host (Fox news' own word)
I personally think the counterpoints to pipa report shouldn't be included but the change should be labled "minor spelling change"
rv back to Silverback - "far more" is clearly POV based on how you define left and right - I think all agree that the allegations are that they are right - lets leave it at that
revert to my version; see talk
rv to Silverback, I doubt the critics that consider the broadcast networks to the right are significant, post links to talk, or insert links that establish the claims in your text here
actually, there is; read a few liberal blogs, and you'll catch references to the 'SCLM', or So-Called Liberal Media--there's a wide dissatisfaction. ask for links on talk, if you like
/* Allegations of bias */ Is there documentation that the critics think the Fox's peers are slanted to the right, as implied by Fox being far MORE slanted to right?
rv. There are no left wing mainstream broadcasters
/* Allegations of bias */ "far more to the right"? Which of its peers do the mainstream critics allege is slanted to the "right" at all?
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/207.134.155.3|207.134.155.3]] to last version by TrÃ¶del
taking out advising the bush admin after 9/11 - think this refers to the Ailles memo made public by Woodward - one memo does not make an advisor - disagree? - lets talk on talk page
/* Allegations of bias */ combined the two bullet points on the 2000 Election

Probably did use FOX is clearly a supposition - see talk
There is no way you can call it OR. What's more, Chomsky probably did use Fox as an example.
/* Allegations of bias */ Original research, unless Chomsky and Herman have said as much about Fox News in particular
rv. That would be a creative interpretation of the policy
/* Allegations of bias */ Any connection between the propaganda model and Fox News is original research. The public reponse to alleged Fox bias more likely confirms and encourages it, than the revers
/* Allegations of bias */ add link to all the memos full text - move Propogand model to one place
/* Allegations of bias */ The [[Propaganda model]] states that any commercial media organisation must inevitably be biased in order to remain competitive.
include more detail and move near a summary as an explanation of the allegation of bias
discussion is ongoing - see talk page
removed propoganda model pending discussion on talk page
rephrased slightly - will explain on talk page
move Propaganda to end of Allegations of Bias section
Tony, why do you remove my hard work? Please ensure some reference to the propaganda model is left somewhere in the article. Despite the name, it's not about "propaganda". Please give revert reason.

/* Allegations of bias */ as suggested, making the PIPA reverence more acceptable despite its not having anything to do with bias

rv to Silverback, don't abuse the minor edit box, provide an edit summary or a comment on the talk page

/* Allegations of bias */ the opinions of Fox viewers is not evidence of Fox News bias, these viewers self select and have their views before Fox, and may adopt their views despite accurate reporting
/* Allegations of bias */ my second try
/* Allegations of bias */ Fumbled earlier edit...

how's this - didn't like the word "spin" - also removed redundant link
/* Allegations of bias */ Longer list, if we can't have a right-wing/republican/conservative/other adjective
/* Allegations of bias */ this is more descriptive, while the issues this site emphasizes coincide with the administration position, except for tax cuts they are bi-partisan
/* Allegations of bias */ Let's try another adj. phrase, then.
/* Allegations of bias */ deleting original research, "right-wing" is not mentioned in the memos, of the issues discussed, only tax-cuts clearly right wing
